location.description:
We offer professional buyout services with free equipment pickup from any location in Florida—no need for you to leave your home. In Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Hialeah, and Hollywood, you can sell your tools and receive cash on the spot within 1–2 hours.

For clients in other areas of Florida, our appraisers arrive within:

South Florida (2–4 hours): West Palm Beach, Hollywood, Boca Raton, Coral Springs, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Homestead, Aventura, and surrounding regions.

Central Florida (4–6 hours): Orlando, Tampa, St. Petersburg, Clearwater, Lakeland, Daytona Beach, Ocala, The Villages, and surrounding communities.

North Florida (6–8 hours): Jacksonville, Tallahassee, Gainesville, Pensacola, Panama City, Lake City, St. Augustine, and nearby areas.

list.title: We offer complimentary pickup anywhere in Florida, seven days a week.
We buy drills, impact drivers, and rotary tools in all conditions — whether new, used, or worn from jobsite work.
All shipping costs for your drill are fully covered, even if you're outside Florida.
We’ll pay you cash the same day for your drill.
We specialize in buying tools with issues — financing, damage, or missing parts.
Get a free online quote without leaving your home.
Our offers are consistently higher than local pawn shops.
No pressure, no games — the choice is entirely yours.

listAsq.title: What types and brands of drills do you buy in Florida?
listAsq.content:
We purchase all types of electric and cordless drills, including: standard power drills, cordless drills, hammer drills, rotary drills, SDS drills, right-angle drills, brushless drills, screw guns, and combination drill/driver sets.
Top brands we frequently buy include DeWalt, Milwaukee, Makita, Bosch, RIDGID, Ryobi, Hilti, Craftsman, Metabo HPT, Kobalt, Porter-Cable, Hart, Ingersoll Rand, and Black+Decker.

listAsq.title: How can I sell my used drill?
listAsq.content:
We’ve made the process of selling your drill as simple and convenient as possible. Start with a free online appraisal — just send us a few photos of your drill (and any related tools or accessories) through your preferred messaging app.
Within 10 minutes, our specialist will provide you with a cash offer.
If you accept, we’ll dispatch a team to you immediately with cash in hand.
Prefer to visit our office? We’ll be happy to welcome you in person.

listAsq.title: Who buys drills for cash?
listAsq.content:
There are many ways to sell your drill online — and we’re here to help you understand each one:
  • Facebook Marketplace: Long response times and in-person meetings with strangers.
  • OfferUp: Most buyers are resellers who offer the lowest prices.
  • eBay: Fast sales but high seller fees and shipping hassle.
  • Pawn shops: Quick cash, but usually the lowest payout.

With us, the choice is clear. While we may not always be the absolute highest offer, we guarantee speed, safety, and professional service every step of the way.

listAsq.title: When will I receive payment for my drill?
listAsq.content: Payment is made on the spot after a quick inspection to verify functionality. You can choose to be paid in cash, by business check, or via bank transfer — whichever method works best for you.

listAsq.title: I also have batteries, chargers, and other tools — can I sell them with my drill?
listAsq.content:
Absolutely. The final offer will reflect the condition of your drill, and whether it includes accessories like batteries, a charger, or the original box.
To maximize your offer, we recommend cleaning off dust and dirt and preparing all items together before pickup.
